byline.contributor: Stephen Castle contributed reporting from Brussels, and Louise Story from New York.

abstract: American stocks rise as European officials are said to be near completion of broad agreement between Germany and France on large infusion of bailout money; serious consideration is being given to increasing size of bailout fund of 440 billion euros to at least 1 trillion to 1.5 trillion euros with discussions taking on greater urgency after Moody's warning of a possible downgrade of France's flawless credit rating.
snippet: France may be placed on watch for a downgrade if the costs of supporting banks and other euro countries hurt its finances, the agency said.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Credit Ratings and Credit Rating Agencies

lead_paragraph: France may be placed on watch for a downgrade if the costs of supporting banks and other euro countries hurt its finances, the agency said.

headline.main: Hopes of Big Deal in Europe, Then Denials
headline.print_headline: Hopes of Big Deal in Europe, Then Denials
headline.seo: France to Defend Credit Rating After Moody’s Warning
